fig.title: Toolbar Save button in deferred update mode

image.alt: Toolbar Save button in deferred update mode

section.p:
These modes are controlled by the Deferred mode checkbox in the Settings window (see ) which is accessible only to the system administrator. In the immediate mode all updates to the database are performed immediately. In deferred mode updates are actually performed with a temporary copy of the database. This means that any changes made by a user are saved in this temporary copy and will only be transferred to the actual database when Save database function is invoked. This command must be invoked manually from either the main menu or the toolbar button . At the end of the session the user will be prompted to save the changes if any are pending. The Autosave option (see ) allows to save the changes automatically at preset intervals.
